intro: Satureja pseudosimensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of California. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in open woodland or alpine meadows. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in the summer months. Satureja pseudosimensis is valued for its fragrant foliage and is sometimes used in local herbal remedies.
